repast.simphony.agents.flows.tasks

Class AgentBuilderManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • repast.simphony.agents.flows.tasks.AgentBuilderManager

  • public class AgentBuilderManager
extends java.lang.Object
    With the help of the AgentBuilderManager you can register and execute flows.
    Author:
    agreif (Adapted by Michael J. North for Use in Repast Simphony from Alexander Greif’s Flow4J-Eclipse (http://flow4jeclipse.sourceforge.net/docs/index.html), with Thanks to the Original Author)

      • registerTaskFlowlet

        public static ITaskStep registerTaskFlowlet(java.lang.String className)
                                     throws AgentBuilderRuntimeException
        Registers the task. Puts the task's singleton in the taskFlowlet registry map.
        Parameters:
        className - the task class's fully qualified class name
        Returns:
        the registeren task flowlet instance
        Throws:
        AgentBuilderRuntimeException - if the class does not implement the ITaskStep interface or if the classname is incorrect or if the task instance cannot be registered (taskname already registered but with different class)

      • registerTaskFlowlet

        public static ITaskStep registerTaskFlowlet(java.lang.Class taskFlowletClass)
        Registers the task.
        Parameters:
        taskFlowletClass -
        Returns:
        the registeren task flowlet instance

      • registerFlow

        public static IAgent registerFlow(java.lang.String className)
                           throws AgentBuilderRuntimeException
        Registers the flow. Puts the flow's singleton in the flow registry map.
        Parameters:
        className - the flow class's fully qualified class name
        Returns:
        the registered flow instance
        Throws:
        AgentBuilderRuntimeException - if the class does not implement the IAgent interface or if the classname is incorrect or if the flow instance cannot be registered (already exists)

        Returns:
        the registered flow instance

      • executeFlow

        public static AgentBuilderDictionary executeFlow(java.lang.String flowName,
                                                 java.lang.String startFlowletName)
                                          throws AgentBuilderRuntimeException
        Executes the given flow with the given start node and an empty dictionary. Returns the automatically generated AgentBuilderDictionary which might have been manipulated/filled by flowlets.
        Parameters:
        flowName - the name of the flow
        startFlowletName - name of the start node
        Returns:
        the automatically generated AgentBuilderDictionary.
        Throws:
        AgentBuilderRuntimeException - if something goes wrong

      • executeFlow

        public static AgentBuilderDictionary executeFlow(java.lang.String flowStart)
                                          throws AgentBuilderRuntimeException
        Executes the flow with a newly created dictionary. The syntax for the flow and its start node is: flowname-startflowletname Returns the automatically generated AgentBuilderDictionary which might have been manipulated/filled by flowlets.
        Parameters:
        flowStart - the flow and it's start node
        Returns:
        the automatically generated AgentBuilderDictionary.
        Throws:
        AgentBuilderRuntimeException - if something goes wrong

      • executeFlow

        public static void executeFlow(java.lang.String flowStart,
                               AgentBuilderDictionary dictionary)
                        throws AgentBuilderRuntimeException
        Executes the flow. The flow has to be registered prior calling this method. The syntax for the flow and it's start node is:
        flowname-startflowletname
        Parameters:
        flowStart - the flow and it's start node
        dictionary - the dictionary containing the runtime data
        Throws:
        AgentBuilderRuntimeException - if something goes wrong

      • executeFlow

        public static void executeFlow(java.lang.String flowName,
                               java.lang.String startFlowletName,
                               AgentBuilderDictionary dictionary)
                        throws AgentBuilderRuntimeException
        Executes the start node of the given flow that uses the supported dictionary. The flow has to be registered prior calling this method. The syntax for the flow and it's start flowlet is:
        flowname-startflowletname
        Parameters:
        flowName - the name of the flow
        startFlowletName - name of the start flowlet
        dictionary - the map that contains runtime data
        Throws:
        AgentBuilderRuntimeException - if something goes wrong

      • executeFlow

        public static AgentBuilderDictionary executeFlow(java.lang.Class flowClass,
                                                 java.lang.String startFlowletName)
        Executes the start node of the given flow. The flow does not need to be registered when using this method, because the flow class is defined directly.
        You can use it like:
        AgentBuilderManager.executeFlow(MyFlow.class, "Step"); Returns the automatically generated AgentBuilderDictionary which might have been manipulated/filled by flowlets.
        Parameters:
        flowClass - the flow's class
        startFlowletName - name of the start flowlet
        Returns:
        the automatically generated AgentBuilderDictionary.

      • executeFlow

        public static void executeFlow(java.lang.Class flowClass,
                               java.lang.String startFlowletName,
                               AgentBuilderDictionary dictionary)
        Executes the start node of the given flow and a valid flow dictionary. The flow does not need to be registered when using this method, because the flow class is defined directly.
        You can use it like:
        AgentBuilderManager.executeFlow(MyFlow.class, "Step");
        Parameters:
        flowClass - the flow's class
        startFlowletName - name of the start flowlet
        dictionary - the map that contains runtime data

      • getFlow

        public static IAgent getFlow(java.lang.String flowName)
        Returns the flow singleton instance associated to the given flow name
        Parameters:
        flowName -
        Returns:
        the flow singleton instance
